misrepresentation_or_fraud: Imposter entered Canada using a child's passport obtained by parents under questionable circumstances.
document_authenticity: An imposter used it to enter Canada illegally within weeks.
regulatory_compliance: Under the Canadian Passport Order, Passport Canada can revoke passports if misused and deny services to applicants involved in misuse.
decision_outcome: Passport Canada had authority to revoke the passport and deny services for five years; the decision was reasonable and aligned with regulations.
standard_of_review: Federal Court reviewed evidence and legal interpretations.

applicant appealed

cause_of_action: Dispute over the sale of an incomplete luxury yacht under arrest due to unpaid invoices and claims.
specific_rule_applied: Rule 490 of the Federal Courts Rules
procedure_followed: Prothonotary Lafrenière initially approved the sale. Sargeant appealed, arguing against the forced sale. The appeal was heard de novo.
decision_reasoning: The Vessel has been under arrest for four years, depreciating in value. No higher offers were presented, and moving or maintaining the Vessel would incur additional costs. Sargeant did not challenge the $5 million offer with evidence of higher value.
result_of_case: Appeal dismissed; the Vessel will be sold according to the June 30, 2014 order.
decision_made: The Prothonotary did not err; the sale is approved as fair and just under the circumstances.

cause_of_action: Dispute over proper respondent naming in an appeal regarding compensation offer adequacy.
procedure_followed: Motion by the Crown for extension and directions on respondent naming; Administrator opposed but did not file a Notice of Appearance.
decision_reasoning: Administrator acts independently and may be considered adverse in interest.
result_of_case: Administrator accepted as respondent; no costs ordered; timeline extended for subsequent steps.
relevant_rule: Rule 338 of the Federal Courts Rules
court_ruling: The court granted the extension for filing proof of service and allowed the appeal to proceed with the Administrator as the respondent.
